NVO: Niški aerodrom ostao bez tri linije, Vlada Srbije stavlja privatne interese iznad javnog

01 Nov 2019, 11:15

Pod direktnim ili indirektnim uticajem republičkih vlasti, niški aerodrom je za osam dana ostao bez tri linije, saopštila je danas Nacionalna koalicija za decentralizaciju (NKD), nevladina organizacija iz Niša."Od gašenja linije 'Er Srbije' (Air Serbia) Niš-Budimpešta sa zvaničnim objašnjenjem koje je upadljivo nelogično, daleko više zabrinjava uredba Vlade Srbije kojom je praktično zabranjena linija 'Rajanera' (Ryanair) na relaciji Niš-Frankfurt", navodi se u saopštenju.Koalicija dodaje da je od te irske "lou-kost" (low cost) kompanije stigla zvanična ocena da je Rajaner "žrtva monopola kompanije Er Srbija". Usledilo je, kako se navodi i nelogično povlačenje popularne linije "Sviser" (Swiss Air) na relaciji Niš-Cirih, gde živi veliki broj ljudi iz Srbije. "Linije za Frankfurt i Cirih su, po svemu sudeći, žrtve subvencionisanih linija 'Er Srbije' do Hana (kod Frankfurta), odnosno do Fridrihshafena", navela je NKD.NKD je reagovala povodom davanja subvencija kompaniji "Er Srbija" za 12 linija iz Niša i upozorila da je moguća posledica gašenje postojećih linija."Preuzimanjem (niškog) aerodroma, Ministarstvo gradjevinarstva i saobraćaja je od početka imalo za cilj proterivanje 'lou kost' kompanija, pa verujemo da je država zadovoljna ovakvim ishodom, pogubnim po gradjane i već dovoljno devastiranu ekonomiju juga Srbije", navela je NKD.U saopštenju piše i da "Vlada Srbije interese srpsko-arapske avio-kompanije stavlja ispred dobrobiti gradjana i oživljavanja južne Srbije, jednog od najsiromašnijih regiona u Evropi"."Stavljanje privatnih, partikularnih interesa iznad javnog, nedvosmisleni je pokazatelj stanja zarobljene države na koji ukazuje i strategija proširenja Evropske unije na Balkan", ocenila je NKD.

NGO: Nis Airport has been left without three lines, the Government of Serbia places private interests above public

01 Nov 2019, 11:15

Under the direct or indirect influence of the republican authorities, the Nis airport has lost three lines in eight days, the National Coalition for Decentralization (NKD), a non-governmental organization from Nis, announced today. "Since the closure of the Air Serbia line Nis-Budapest. with a formal explanation that is strikingly illogical, far more worrying is the government's decree virtually banning the Ryanair line from Nis to Frankfurt, "the statement said. The coalition adds that it is" lo-bone "( low cost) companies have received an official assessment that Rajaner is "a victim of the Er Serbia monopoly". This was followed by the illogical withdrawal of the popular Swiss Air line from Nis to Zurich, where a large number of people from Serbia live. "The lines to Frankfurt and Zurich appear to be victims of subsidized 'Er Serbia' lines to Han (near Frankfurt) and to Friedrichshafen," the NKD.NKD responded by giving subsidies to Er Serbia for 12 lines from Nisha also warned that the possible consequence is the closure of existing lines. "By taking over the (Nis) airport, the Ministry of Construction and Transport aimed at expelling the 'low cost' companies from the beginning, so we believe that the state is satisfied with this outcome, disastrous for the citizens and already enough "The government of Serbia puts the interests of the Serbian-Arab airline ahead of the well-being of the citizens and revitalization of southern Serbia, one of the poorest regions in Europe." "It is an unambiguous indicator of the state of the captured state, which is also indicated by the strategy for the enlargement of the European Union to the Balkans," the NKD estimated.
